abstract: Families of victims of church massacre in Charleston, SC, say they hope that their forgiveness of Dylan Roof will be remembered in wake of shooting and will stand as counterpoint to anger and violence in communities across country; family members had not initially agreed to offer their forgiveness in concert at court hearing, but attribute decision to do so to forgiveness offered by Nadine Collier to Roof during his appearance in court.
lead_paragraph: The families of the victims are still pondering the profound effect their words — allowing love and forgiveness to crowd out hate and vengeance — have had after the Charleston church massacre.

headline.main: Charleston Families Hope Words Endure Past Shooting
